docs.title: Insurance Calculator
docs.text:
A lightweight Spring Boot + Thymeleaf application to calculate car insurance premiums based on:

  • Jahreskilometer (annual mileage)
  • Fahrzeugtyp (vehicle type)
  • Region (postcode → federal state)

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Modular structure (region, quote, web)
  • Configurable region factors in application.yml
  • Postcode lookup via CSV file
  • Persisted quotes in an H2 database
  • Tested with JUnit, Mockito & MockMvc

docs.title: POST /api/quotes/calculate
docs.text: Calculates and persists a new insurance quote.

docs.title: System Architecture
docs.text:
The system follows a modular, layered architecture using Spring Modulith.

Layer Responsibility Web Provides UI and user input forms Quote Calculates and persists premiums Region Loads and maps postcodes to region factors

docs.title: Data Flow
docs.text:
1. User submits the form (km, vehicle type, postcode)
  2. Controller passes data to QuoteService
  3. Service requests regional factor from RegionService
  4. RegionRepository reads the CSV for region mapping
  5. Final premium = kmFactor × vehicleFactor × regionFactor
  6. Result persisted and displayed via Thymeleaf

docs.title: 1. region Module
docs.text:
• Loads postcodes.csv
  • Maps postcode → region code
  • Looks up configurable factors (from YAML)
  • Provides factor via RegionService

docs.title: 2. quote Module
docs.text:
• Calculates insurance premium
  • Applies rounding (2 decimals)
  • Persists quotes in H2 via QuoteRepository
  • Provides REST endpoint /api/quotes/calculate

docs.title: 3. web Module
docs.text:
• Renders Thymeleaf templates (index.html, result.html)
  • Integrates with QuoteService
  • Provides user-friendly web interface

docs.title: 4. Shared Infrastructure
docs.text:
• Uses Spring Boot auto-configuration
  • Uses Spring Modulith for logical separation
